title: News for Sasquatch at the Tucson Teststand.

items.title: Chronograf updated to version 1.10.1
items.content_text: See release notes in the link above for changes since 1.9.4

items.title: Long live Sasquatch!
items.content_text: Sasquatch is a new service of the RSP that hosts the EFD, learn more at SQR-068.

items.title: Increase InfluxDB time precision
items.content_text: Some CSCs send events to the EFD with a time difference smaller than 1ms. We have increasead the time precision in InfluxDB from milliseconds to microseconds to account for that.

items.title: Chronograf 1.9.4
items.content_text: Upgrade Chronograf to the latest release.

items.title: Chronograf 1.9.3
items.content_text: Upgrade Chronograf to the latest release.

items.title: Chronograf 1.9.2 (nightly build)
items.content_text: We've updated Chronograf to a nightly build that includes a fix to issue #5836: Allow to save a new TICKscript, reported by Michael. This will be rolled out elsewhere when 1.9.2 is released.

items.title: Chronograf 1.9.1
items.content_text: This version fixes three issues in Chronograf reported by us (yay!) #5784: Fix Safari display issues of a Single Stat, #5796: Avoid useless browser history change, and #5803: Repair time rendering in horizontal table.

items.title: Tucson Test Stand EFD
items.content_text: We have a new EFD deployment at the Tucson Test Stand ready to use! It has essentially the same configuration used in the EFD at the NCSA Test Stand.

items.title: EFD time scale is now UTC
items.content_text: According to RFC-767 we are switching the EFD time scale from TAI to UTC. This means that when you query the EFD via Chronograf or the EFD client the timestamps for the InfluxDB time column are returned in UTC. So you can use functions like now() in your InfluxQL queries safely, and manipulate time using Flux without worring about the time shift between TAI and UTC. The column private_sndStamp still has the timestamp values in TAI in case you need to work with them.

items.title: EFD time scale is now UTC
items.content_text: According to RFC-767 we are switching the EFD time scale from TAI to UTC. This means that when you query the EFD via Chronograf or the EFD client the timestamps for the InfluxDB time column are returned in UTC. So you can use functions like now() in your InfluxQL queries safely, and manipulate time using Flux without worring about the time shift between TAI and UTC. The column private_sndStamp still has the timestamp values in TAI in case you need to work with them.

items.title: Chronograf display issues with Safari
items.content_text: We have seen issues rendering Tables and Single Stat panels on dashboard cells with recent versions of Safari. We recommend using Chrome for a better experience.

items.title: Custom auto-refresh intervals
items.content_text: In Chronograf 1.9.0 we can now configure custom auto-refresh intervals for dashboards. We added the option to refresh dashboard contents every 1s. However, use this feature with caution if your dashboard has too many cells or if you are querying data on large time ranges.

items.title: Chronograf upgraded to version 1.9.0
items.content_text: Chronograf 1.9.0 brings a number of new features and improvements, see blog post linked above.
